#26129
I hope that's okay to post it here (there are reviewers already but they are probably their holidays or something similar, and I want to get this to the best possible shape for the moment they return).

Few questions:
1) I believe that lemmas about unit length vectors have no independent value, so in the end I decided to put them in the same file as the main result (in section named UnitVectorAngles). Am I right to do this?
2) The definition private noncomputable def ortho (y x : V) : V := x - ⟪x, y⟫ • y at Mathlib/Geometry/Euclidean/Angle/Unoriented/TriangleInequality.lean gives an useful vector and is meant only for unit length vector y. It can be thought as a part of Gram-Schmidt ortogonalization process, I believe, but I don't need the full Gram-Schmidt, imo, so I hope that this definition is okay.

noncomputable def ortho (y x : V) : V := x - ⟪x, y⟫ • y / ‖y‖^2

This would seem fine to me?
Like I can see why you would want this quantity in and of itself.
I would probably call it proj rather than ortho. Also given we have G-S, do we not have this?
So (ℝ ∙ y).starProjection x I believe would be this quantity.
Thank you! Then the new definition of ortho becomes x - (ℝ ∙ y).starProjection x, if I got this right.
In an earlier version of the pr, there was noncomputable def orthoDir (x y : V) : V := normalized (x - ⟪x, normalized y⟫ • normalized y)
which probably shouldn't have had the outermost normalized, but generally that's also another way of saying it
